Posts.Content: Hi everyone. My name is Richard Day Gore. I am a thyroid cancer survivor and normally contribute in various places on the forums. The reason I'm visiting over here is that I am editor at a non profit organization called The Healing Project. We are preparing an anthology of true stories by breast cancer patients/friends/family/caregivers and I'm putting the invitation out to you all. Here is our "official" message about it: Breast cancer. Multiple sclerosis. Autism. Diseases that affect millions. Yet the story of a single patient, caregiver or friend has the power to change lives. LaChance Publishing seeks TRUE stories of literary merit about experiences with these illnesses for publication in its "Voices Of" series, the net profits of which will be donated to The Healing Project, a non-profit organization. We're looking for works with real emotional impact that will touch the heart and lift the spirit. If you or someone you know is a victim, caregiver, friend or family member who has been touched by these diseases and have a story to inspire and inform, visit http://www.thehealingproject.org/main.html for submission guidelines. Please note: breast cancer, MS and autism only at this time. That's it! We really need accounts that stir the deepest emotions, like we see here in the heartfelt posts on the forums. If you submit a story, please mention that you came to The Healing Project from the Cancer Forums. Many thanks to all. Love and best regards, Richard Day Gore www.thehealingproject.org
Posts.Title: Introduction and invitation

Posts.Content: Hello all BC folks, I'm a thyroid cancer survivor who contibutes to this board. I'm working as an editor at The Healing Project, which is compiling stories by patients, survivors, caregivers, family and friends of those who have dealt with major illnesses for publication in a series of anthologies. One of the upcoming volumes will focus on BC. If you have a BC story to tell, please consider reading the little blurb below and visiting the site for more details. We're really hoping that these stories, like these message boards, can make a difference... LaChance Publishing is seeking inspiring, TRUE stories of literary merit about experiences with breast cancer and multiple sclerosis (MS) for publication in its "Voices Of" series, the net profits of which will be donated to The Healing Project, a non-profit organization that serves as the editor of the series. If you or someone you know is a victim, care giver, friend or family member that has been touched by these diseases and have a story to inspire and inform, please visit http://www.thehealingproject.org/main.html for submission guidelines. Love and thanks from Richard Day Gore
